sentence: Shares of salesforce.com Inc.CRM gained 8.8% in after-hour trade yesterday on better-than-expected fourth-quarter fiscal 20Array6 revenues and an optimistic outlook for first quarter and fiscal 20Array7.
Although its bottom line fell short of the Zacks Consensus Estimate, it fared better than the year-ago period figure.

The company reported adjusted earnings (including stock-based compensation but excluding all one-time items on a proportionate tax basis) of Array cent for the fourth quarter as against a loss of Array cent posted in the year-ago period.
However, it missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 4 cents.
Salesforce's revenues of $Array.809 billion not only increased 25.3% year over year but also beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $Array.79Array billion.
Reported revenues also came above management's guided range of $Array.782 billion to $Array.792 billion.
The year-over-year improvement was primarily attributed to rapid adoption of the company's cloud-based solutions.
Among its business segments, revenues from Subscription and Support increased 25% from the year-ago quarter to $Array.68 billion.
Professional Services and Other revenues jumped 28% to $Array27 million.
Geographically, the company witnessed revenue growth of 26.5%, 23.5% and Array8.9% in the Americas, Europe and Asia, respectively, on a year-over-year basis.
Among cloud-based platforms, Sales Cloud increased Array2% on a year over year basis.
Service Cloud grew 35%, Marketing Cloud increased 3Array% whereas Apps Cloud and Others grew 43%.
Salesforce's adjusted gross profit (including stock-based compensation but excluding amortization expenses) came in at $Array.385 billion, up 25% from the year-ago quarter.
However, gross margin contracted Array0 basis points (bps) to 76.6%, primarily due to higher cost of sales.
Adjusted operating expenses (including stock-based compensation but excluding amortization of acquisition-related intangibles) increased 20.Array% from the year-ago quarter to $Array.325 billion.
This was primarily because of higher investments in research and development, marketing and sales and general and administrative activities.
However, as a percentage of revenues, operating expenses contracted 320 bps to 73.2%.

Salesforce posted adjusted operating income (including stock-based compensation but excluding amortization of acquisition-related intangibles) of $60.6 million as against the year-ago income of $5.2 million while operating margin improved 290 bps to 3.3%.
The year-over-year improvement in adjusted operating income and margin was mainly backed by a higher revenue base and a drop in operating expenses as a percentage of revenues.
Salesforce exited the quarter with cash and cash equivalents and marketable securities of $Array.34Array billion compared with $Array.358 billion in the previous quarter.
Accounts receivable were $2.496 billion as against $Array.06Array million at the end of third quarter.
Total deferred revenue, as of Jan 3Array, 20Array6, was $4.29 billion, which increased 29% on a year-over-year basis.
During the quarter, the company generated $459.4 million in cash from operating activities and free cash flow of $390.9 million.
Moreover, in the first four quarters of fiscal 20Array6, Salesforce generated $Array.6Array2 billion cash from operating activities and free cash flow of $Array.328 billion.
Buoyed by the decent results, Salesforce raised its fiscal 20Array7 outlook.
The company now expects revenues in the range of $8.08-$8.Array2 billion, up from $8 billion to $8.Array billon, representing an increase of 2Array% to 22% year over year.
The Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at $8.07 billion.
Non-GAAP earnings per share for fiscal 20Array7 are projected within 99 cents - $Array.0Array per share, while the Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at 36 cents.
Salesforce also issued guidance for the first quarter.
The company expects revenues in the range of $Array.885 billion to $Array.895 billion, reflecting a year-over-year increase of 25%.
The Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at $Array.854 billion.
The company expects non-GAAP earnings per share in the 23 cents to 24 cents range.
The Zacks Consensus Estimate stands at 6 cents.
Salesforce concluded the fourth quarter of fiscal 20Array6 on a strong note with the top and bottom line improving significantly year over year.
The robust top line was primarily backed by growth across all its business segments and Salesforce Cloud platform.
The company also raised its 20Array7 revenue guidance and provided an optimistic first quarter outlook.
The higher number of deal wins and geographical contributions were also encouraging.
We consider the rapid adoption of SalesforceArray Customer Platform to be a positive.
Overall, the company's diverse cloud offerings and considerable spending on digital marketing remain the catalysts.
Moreover, strategic acquisitions and the resultant synergies are expected to benefit over the long run.
In view of increasing customer adoption and satisfactory performances, market research firm Gartner acknowledged Salesforce as the leading social CRM solution provider.
We believe that the rapid adoption of Salesforce's platforms indicate solid growth opportunities in the ever-growing cloud computing segment.

Although the company is growing reasonably in the cloud market, growth prospects have been rationalized to a considerable extent due to intensifying competition from International Business Machines IBM , Oracle Corp. ORCL and SAP SE SAP .
Moreover, currency fluctuations and stepped-up investments in international expansions and data centers could impact near-term results.
